be at odds.translation[0].definitions[0]: Briggs found himself at odds with his colleagues.
The two politicians were at odds over what was the truth.
be at odds.translation[0].definitions[1]: if two statements, descriptions, actions etc are at odds with each other, they are different although they should be the same
Mark’s account of what happened is at odds with Dan’s.
She gave him a sweet smile, totally at odds with the look of dislike in her eyes.
